Omeluum.synopsis: If the player has rescued Omeluum from the Iron Throne, then he is in the Lodge for the Society of Brilliance. He tells the player about the events that led him to be imprisoned on the throne, reflects on the outcomes of the rescue (whether the other hostages/Duke Ravengard were saved), and provides them with a reward for his rescue.
Omeluum.how_to_trigger: - CTY_Main_A- Debugbook option Act3 → LOW - Lodge → Omeluum escaped

AD_SocietyMember_01_Idle.synopsis: Idle ADs  for a Society of Brilliance Member in the lodge

Havkelaag.synopsis: Havkelaag is a member of the Society of Brilliance, who is very interested in proving his theory of Genetic Morality.This dialog only ever plays in case players the gith kid massacre never happens.

GithBoy.synopsis: Dialog file for Ptaris, the Gith born from the egg given to Esther. The player enters on a scene of devestation, Ptaris the only being still alive. Hatched unnaturally from his egg and experimented on in the name of making him 'good', he has developed uncanny psionic powers, and used them to murder everyone who failed to live up to his strict moral code.
GithBoy.how_to_trigger: - CTY_Main_A- Debugbook option Act3 → LOW - LOW Lodge → Set up gith kid massacre state.- Use the portal |Gith Kid Portal| - S_LOW_TheLodge_GithKidArena_PortalDown a22a7d3a-24d7-4f97-a142-75dd623d04ad - (-214; 20; -88)- The dialog will be started when the kid spots you

Blurg.synopsis: Dialog with Blurg in the Lodge.Blurg is present there in case the gith massacre hasn't happened and players have met it in UND.
Blurg.how_to_trigger: - CTY_Main_A- Debugbook option Act3 → LOW - LOW Lodge → Blurg is present- Talk to Blurg at -203; 24; -80

SwD_Havkelaag.synopsis: SwD with Havkelaag that is present only in case of gith kid massacre.
SwD_Havkelaag.how_to_trigger: - CTY_Main_A- Debugbook option Act3 → LOW - LOW Lodge → Set up gith kid massacre state.- SwD Havkelaag - S_LOW_Havkelaag 8f24c3d5-33cd-4e4f-8c34-4fbc8863862d - (-208; 20; -86)

PAD_GithKidMassacre.synopsis: PAD for when players enter massacred lodge
PAD_GithKidMassacre.how_to_trigger: - CTY_Main_A- Debugbook option Act3 → LOW - LOW Lodge → Set up gith kid massacre state.- Enter the Lodge, PAD will play -214; 20; -81

AD_SocietyMember_04_Idle.synopsis: Idle ADs  for a Society of Brilliance Member in the lodge

AD_Blurg_Idle.synopsis: Idle ADs  for Blurg in the lodge
AD_Blurg_Idle.how_to_trigger: - CTY_Main_A- Debugbook option Act3 → LOW - LOW Lodge → Blurg is present

AD_SocietyMember_03_Idle.synopsis: Idle ADs  for a Society of Brilliance Member in the lodge

AD_PtarisFightShouting.how_to_trigger: - CTY_Main_A- Debugbook option Act3 → LOW - LOW Lodge → Set up gith kid massacre state.- Use the portal |Gith Kid Portal| - S_LOW_TheLodge_GithKidArena_PortalDown a22a7d3a-24d7-4f97-a142-75dd623d04ad - (-214; 20; -88)- The dialog will be started when the kid spots you- Choose aggresive option, the Kid will AD while fighting

AD_OmeluumAndBlurgChatting.synopsis: If Omeluum is present at the Lodge, it and Blurg are catching up, and comparing their experience of being topside.Blurg is using mindmeld to talk with Omeluum
AD_OmeluumAndBlurgChatting.how_to_trigger: - CTY_Main_A- Debugbook option Act3 → LOW - Lodge → Omeluum escaped

AD_Havkelaag_Idle.synopsis: Idle ADs  for Havkelaag in the lodge

AD_SocietyMember_02_Idle.synopsis: Idle ADs for Delverdenn, a Society of Brilliance Member in the lodge.

AD_PtarisBeforeFight.synopsis: Ptaris' ADs for when he's in the basement alone.
AD_PtarisBeforeFight.how_to_trigger: - CTY_Main_A- Debugbook option Act3 → LOW - LOW Lodge → Set up gith kid massacre state.- Use the portal |Gith Kid Portal| - S_LOW_TheLodge_GithKidArena_PortalDown a22a7d3a-24d7-4f97-a142-75dd623d04ad - (-214; 20; -88)

Omeluum_6.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_6.text: Such violence has no place here. The Society is an institution that aims to bring about peace. Not destruction.

Omeluum_13.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_13.text: Blurg... my loyal friend. I will not find the likes of his mind and curiosity again.

Omeluum_57.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_57.text: This city is no place for the peaceful pursuit of knowledge. I am... disappointed.

Omeluum_59.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_59.text: I take it you came here to seek a reward for my rescue?

Omeluum_3.speaker: Player
Omeluum_3.text: Now that you mention it, saving you was a lot of effort...

Omeluum_2.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_2.text: Based on my observations, I have selected certain items I believe will be useful in fighting your cause.

Omeluum_30.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_30.text: I hope they help you to avoid the fate shared by my colleagues.
Omeluum_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld. Omeluum hands reward to player (unseen)

Omeluum_54.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_54.text: Search at your leisure. I must prepare for my return to the Underdark.

Omeluum_93.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_93.text: At least there my research may yet do some good, even without the support of the Society.

Omeluum_9.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_9.text: It is what Blurg would have wanted.

Omeluum_67.speaker: Player
Omeluum_67.text: I killed your colleagues. I just came to finish the job.

Omeluum_8.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: MindmeldNodeContext: Angered, about to attack

Omeluum_23.speaker: Player
Omeluum_23.text: No need. You've lost too much here already.

Omeluum_39.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_39.text: I must agree. I feel a surprising heaviness within me. But it will pass, I am sure.

Omeluum_11.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_11.text: I will return to the Underdark alone. My research there may yet help its inhabitants, even without the Society's help.

Omeluum_52.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_52.text: It is... pleasurable to see you. Your intervention within the cult's underwater complex was a timely one.

Omeluum_61.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_61.text: I am glad my carelessness did not cost the life of Duke Ravengard.

Omeluum_36.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_36.text: That you also saved me was unexpected.

Omeluum_38.speaker: Player
Omeluum_38.text: Why were you down there in the first place?

Omeluum_5.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_5.text: My meeting with you led me to a most unsettling conclusion. That my kind had begun to exert influence through this 'Cult of the Absolute.'

Omeluum_50.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_50.text: I felt illithid interference would not be conducive to this plane's survival. I sought out other infected individuals to ascertain the truth of my hypothesis.

Omeluum_1.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_1.text: Unfortunately, I strayed too close. I was captured and transported to the prison in which you found me.

Omeluum_96.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_96.text: There I saw Gortash and his followers inflict cruelties far beyond any I witnessed in the Underdark.

Omeluum_76.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_76.text: I am grateful that you were spared such a merciless fate.

Omeluum_26.speaker: Player
Omeluum_26.text: You tried to save me once. Only fair that I repay the favour.

Omeluum_46.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_46.text: Then you would keep our equation balanced. A logical approach.

Omeluum_68.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_68.text: The aid you rendered to me far outweighs that which I provided in the Underdark.

Omeluum_65.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_65.text: The ring I gave possessed no real capacity to control the tadpole's influence. I simply wished to give you hope.

Omeluum_37.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_37.text: Because hope is important to your kind. Given enough of it, I believed you would not give up on finding the explanation for your tadpole's stasis.

Omeluum_58.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_58.text: Now I am able to provide more tangible means of assisting in your continued survival.

Omeluum_81.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_81.text: Blurg and I have consulted on the matter of your reward.

Omeluum_102.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_102.text: We first thought to ask the denizens of the Underdark for their aid in fighting the cult. Alas, our influence there remains negligible.

Omeluum_89.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_89.text: Instead, we have selected a series of items from the Society's vaults.

Omeluum_100.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_100.text: Given my kind's involvement in creating this evil, it is only right that I do my part in helping you defeat it. Or at least, improving your odds.
Omeluum_100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld. Omeluum hands reward to player (unseen)

Omeluum_91.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_91.text: Curious. I appear to have left them elsewhere in the Lodge.
Omeluum_91.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld. Omeluum gestures as though about to take out an item. He doesn't find it.

Omeluum_32.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_32.text: You found me at the bottom of the harbour. No doubt you will track them down with ease.

Omeluum_84.speaker: Player
Omeluum_84.text: Don't worry. I realised for myself some time ago.

Omeluum_49.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_49.text: As was to be expected. It was only a temporary measure, but one I believed might give you time to find a genuine explanation for your tadpole's stasis.

Omeluum_69.speaker: Player
Omeluum_69.text: So I've been wearing that ring for nothing?

Omeluum_66.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_66.text: You wore it because you believed it helped. Therefore it was helping you. Your belief was the ring's purpose, and it served it well.

Omeluum_20.speaker: Player
Omeluum_20.text: You tricked me. I cannot abide trickery.

Omeluum_78.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_78.text: The ring possessed no ability to interfere with your tadpole's stasis. You were in no more danger than before. However, I understand you are disappointed.

Omeluum_41.speaker: Player
Omeluum_41.text: That's legitimate - my master used similar conceptual tools to focus my mind during training.

Omeluum_43.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_43.text: Indeed. It is sometimes necessary to divert the unformed mind from distractions that lead thinking away from the path of truth.

Omeluum_33.speaker: Player
Omeluum_33.text: I would never have left you behind. I rather like you.

Omeluum_103.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_103.text: I too feel some... warmth at your presence.

Omeluum_18.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_18.text: Your inclination to generosity is an admirable quality. One I wish to reciprocate.

Omeluum_71.speaker: Player
Omeluum_71.text: Gratitude won't keep a roof over my head...

Omeluum_86.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_86.text: I understand my gratitude has limited use. You desire more practical compensation for your troubles.

Omeluum_75.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_75.text: Once my report is completed, I will return to my usual work in the Underdark. There, at least, I may yet produce worthwhile results.

Omeluum_0.speaker: Player
Omeluum_0.text: Hard for you to reward me from the bottom of the ocean.

Omeluum_99.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_99.text: A valid hypothesis. One I am glad we do not need to prove.

Omeluum_24.speaker: Player
Omeluum_24.text: I'd no idea your expectations of me were so low.

Omeluum_105.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_105.text: It was not a judgement on your abilities. It was simply the result of my calculations, given the likely outcomes of such a rescue attempt.

Omeluum_55.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_55.text: I believed my life to be of the least value in the equation. But I am grateful to have it, as is the Society.

Omeluum_72.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_72.text: Welcome to the Society of Brilliance.

Omeluum_4.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_4.text: My colleagues here are grateful you came to my rescue. Though I regret that my investigations ended in such failure.

Omeluum_14.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_14.text: I did not expect that mine would be the life you chose to save.

Omeluum_106.speaker: Player
Omeluum_106.text: Why were you down there in the first place?

Omeluum_35.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_35.text: I knew my imprisonment was of my own making. I therefore believed it best for you to save those who invited no such consequence.

Omeluum_101.speaker: Player
Omeluum_101.text: A generous attitude. Most would only think to save themselves.

Omeluum_48.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_48.text: I do not share my kind's opinions on the value of other living beings. I would have seen them all saved, if I could.

Omeluum_80.speaker: Player
Omeluum_80.text: I tried to save everyone. It just wasn't possible.

Omeluum_22.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_22.text: Indeed. Once a reaction has been set in motion, it is difficult to prevent its completion.

Omeluum_95.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_95.text: He meant something to this city. Yet it was I you rescued.

Omeluum_29.speaker: Player
Omeluum_29.text: The hostages meant nothing to me.

Omeluum_53.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_53.text: They were innocents, whereas I brought my fate upon myself.

Omeluum_25.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_25.text: Do not think me ungrateful. I am pleased at my continued existence.

Omeluum_31.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_31.text: Still, I feel a heaviness within me. Ravengard's death will destabilise Baldur's Gate. It may adapt, or it may perish. But it will undoubtedly be transformed.

Omeluum_12.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_12.text: Blurgh and I have consulted on the matter of your reward. Your efforts require some recognition.

Omeluum_44.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_44.text: Still, I feel a heaviness within me, that my life alone should be worth the loss of so many others. Such extinctions are... regrettable.

Omeluum_28.speaker: Player
Omeluum_28.text: I didn't care who 'deserved' to be saved. You have the most to offer me.

Omeluum_42.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_42.text: Ah. Then you did not act so impulsively as I. And your assumption was not an unfounded one.

Omeluum_94.speaker: Player
Omeluum_94.text: The Society has deep pockets. I expect to get paid for it.

Omeluum_73.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_73.text: It is... pleasurable to see you. Your intervention within the cult's underwater complex was a timely one.

Omeluum_79.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_79.text: I am glad my carelessness did not cost the lives of the innocents captives.

Omeluum_97.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_97.text: Such violence has no place here. The Society is an institution that aims to bring about peace. Not destruction.

Omeluum_104.speaker: Omeluum
Omeluum_104.text: It is best I do not interfere further with events on the surface. I will return to my research - it has been neglected long enough.

AD_SocietyMember_01_Idle_0.speaker: Doctor Moorcombe
AD_SocietyMember_01_Idle_0.text: Need spores. Could there be myconids in the Undercity?

AD_SocietyMember_01_Idle_1.speaker: Doctor Moorcombe
AD_SocietyMember_01_Idle_1.text: If I publish my research, everyone will want spores. Dare I?

AD_SocietyMember_01_Idle_2.speaker: Doctor Moorcombe
AD_SocietyMember_01_Idle_2.text: Should dangerous research be suppressed for the common good?

Havkelaag_14.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_14.text: You find yourself in the cradle of all knowledge relating to the Underdark: the Society of Brilliance.

Havkelaag_130.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_130.text: Tell me, what can the Society do for you?

Havkelaag_7.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_7.text: I met an expeditioner claiming to work for you. She sought a githyanki egg.

Havkelaag_58.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_58.text: Yes, dear Lady Esther. One of our most reliable contractors, though unfortunately this particular request was too much even for her.

Havkelaag_78.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_78.text: I believe she quite lost her senses over the task. She came here insisting I purchase an owlbear egg from her, of all things.

Havkelaag_82.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_82.text: I don't suppose you've stumbled across any githyanki eggs during your travels? The Society will compensate you for any we purchase, of course. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Havkelaag_25.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_25.text: Once the dust is settled on this whole invading army mess outside the walls, I'll find another contractor. Perhaps they will have more success.

Havkelaag_34.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_34.text: Was there anything else? I should really get back to my research.

Havkelaag_57.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_57.text: Feel free to explore the Lodge. Our knowledge is here for the common good, after all.

Havkelaag_4.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_4.text: I carry an unhatched githyanki egg. Would you be interested in studying it?

Havkelaag_74.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_74.text: A githyanki egg? What a fortuitous turn of events. I've been attempting to get my hands on one for some time now.

Havkelaag_122.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_122.text: Would you consider parting with it? The Society's coffers are deep enough to cover any expenses accrued in its retrieval, of course. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Havkelaag_76.speaker: Lae'zel
Havkelaag_76.text: Chk. Don't you dare consider it.

Havkelaag_1.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_1.text: What are you going to do with it?

Havkelaag_62.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_62.text: Study it, of course. The githyanki have been a source of great debate in the Society's circles in recent months.

Havkelaag_32.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_32.text: You yourself have no doubt experienced the prejudice of those who assume that, as beings of the Underdark, we are inherently evil.

Havkelaag_123.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_123.text: The githyanki face similar prejudice, but I believe, if hatched in a less violent, more intellectually stimulating environment, the child can overcome its evil predispositions.

Havkelaag_121.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_121.text: You are no doubt aware that citizens of the Underdark are held in great suspicion by those who live above ground. Many believe us to be 'evil'.

Havkelaag_41.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_41.text: Study it, of course. Your kind have been a source of great debate in the Society's circles in recent months.

Havkelaag_75.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_75.text: Most on this plane believe you to be innately cruel, violent beings. Evil, if you will.

Havkelaag_30.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_30.text: As citizens of the Underdark, we face similar stigmas. Totally unfounded, of course - our natures are as unfixed as any who walk the surface.

Havkelaag_132.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_132.text: I believe that, if hatched in a morally sound, intellectually stimulating environment, the child can overcome the evil predisposition its githyanki nature bestows.

Havkelaag_103.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_103.text: What does this 'intellectually stimulating' upbringing look like?

Havkelaag_100.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_100.text: In the literal sense, I will need to induce the egg to hatch via the application of certain currents to the creature inside.

Havkelaag_115.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_115.text: So the child inside will be experimented on?

Havkelaag_117.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_117.text: You're letting your personal biases affect your method. Why assume they're evil?

Havkelaag_36.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_36.text: I assume nothing. Innate githyanki cruelty is an established fact - no doubt you witnessed it yourself in the retrieval of the egg itself.

Havkelaag_53.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_53.text: You assume my people are evil, yet your research is built on sheer superstition.

Havkelaag_33.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_33.text: Enough of your kind have wreaked destruction on this plane for me to be confident in my assertion.

Havkelaag_84.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_84.text: When I have a suitable sample for my study, I will, however, prove that the effects of their biological inclination are reversible.

Havkelaag_52.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_52.text: Once out of the shell, I plan to take a twofold approach:

Havkelaag_124.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_124.text: The enforced repetition of sound moral principles from the Ptarian code, alongside a series of psionic pulses administered to the cerebral tissue.

Havkelaag_43.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_43.text: Assuming I can accelerate its growth, I should have conclusive findings within a year or two at the most.

Havkelaag_42.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_42.text: A series of moral imperatives bestowed by the great dragon-deity Bahamut.

Havkelaag_102.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_102.text: In my years of study, they're the closest I've found to moral perfection. Only under such rigorous 'goodness' will the subject stand a chance of being cured.

Havkelaag_61.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_61.text: So you're planning to torture a child for a year?

Havkelaag_114.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_114.text: The child will be a better individual after my treatment than it ever would have been had it been raised in its natural environment.

Havkelaag_96.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_96.text: Any suffering it endures will therefore be worth it, for the child, perhaps for the whole of civilised society.

Havkelaag_128.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_128.text: My findings could change the perception of githyanki and the peoples of the Underdark for generations to come.

Havkelaag_135.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_135.text: And what if your experiment fails?

Havkelaag_139.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_139.text: If the child remains evil after the experiment is concluded, it will be destroyed. Such is the fate of all used specimens.

Havkelaag_27.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_27.text: No benefit could justify you inflicting such cruelty.

Havkelaag_97.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_97.text: Rigorous experimental methods demand we do not indulge our own emotional responses in the application of discomfort to our subjects.

Havkelaag_0.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_0.text: Only by the full, uninhibited application of psionic stimuli will we have a true measure of whether the child's innate evil has been cured.

Havkelaag_21.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_21.text: Now, I'm eager to get started, so will you sell me the egg? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Havkelaag_127.speaker: Lae'zel
Havkelaag_127.text: A gith hatchling is not a lab rat! This shka'keth should be bled dry for the mere suggestion.

Havkelaag_55.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_55.text: Wonderful. I'll begin making preliminary notes at once.

Havkelaag_63.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_63.text: You've provided me with a fine specimen. I'll be sure to mention your name in the footnotes.

Havkelaag_56.speaker: Lae'zel
Havkelaag_56.text: Tsk'va! To think I trusted you with such a treasure!

Havkelaag_77.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_77.text: Ah. Unfortunately, it seems I've mislaid my purse.

Havkelaag_73.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_73.text: I don't suppose you'd consider simply donating it to the Society instead?

Havkelaag_20.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_20.text: That is a shame. I'll have to find another way to procure a specimen. Or some additional funds.

Havkelaag_134.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_134.text: This experiment is barbaric. You're never getting the egg.

Havkelaag_85.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_85.text: Then I will source another subject, and the experiment will be completed without your involvement.

Havkelaag_51.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_51.text: Progress may be delayed, but I assure you - it can never be stopped.

Havkelaag_86.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_86.text: Sounds pointless. Public opinion will hardly be swayed by such a small experiment.

Havkelaag_10.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_10.text: Not at first. But if the experiment proves successful, it must be repeated. Only then will we know if the findings are to be trusted.

Havkelaag_11.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_11.text: An experiment like this will only confirm the surface dwellers' suspicion of us.

Havkelaag_106.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_106.text: Of course it won't. If anything, it will do quite the opposite. The academic institutions up here will finally be forced to take us seriously.

Havkelaag_69.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_69.text: Your findings are irrelevant, as are the opinions of all on this kaincha plane.

Havkelaag_16.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_16.text: Ah. A display of the well-known githyanki arrogance. I am not sure my experiment can cure that particular affliction, but give me time and I will find a way.

Havkelaag_136.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_136.text: This experiment is exactly the kind of evil you're trying to disprove.

Havkelaag_111.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_111.text: The pursuit of knowledge is neither evil nor good. Only in the application of such knowledge should one take on any moral imperative.

Havkelaag_140.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_140.text: You'd better get cracking, then. Here's the egg.

Havkelaag_125.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_125.text: Not interested. The egg stays with me.

Havkelaag_109.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_109.text: Shka'keth. You will not live to torment the yank within that shell.

Havkelaag_9.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_9.text: The Society have studied your kind's brutality for years. You will not find us so easily intimidated.

Havkelaag_2.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_2.text: A githyanki sympathiser? I'd no idea their evil could be passed on. Leave our premises - at once!

Havkelaag_101.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_101.text: Why follow the dogma of a draconic god?

Havkelaag_133.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_133.text: So you, too, follow the teachings of Bahamut. Why him?

Havkelaag_129.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_129.text: That kind of indoctrination and time-forced nurture violates the natural order. It invalidates the whole experiment.

Havkelaag_143.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_143.text: I won't bother to argue with you. An arboreal shaman can't be expected to understand the rigorous protocols of theoretical research.

Havkelaag_112.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_112.text: You would teach the child virtue, but rear it without patience. Curious.

Havkelaag_80.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_80.text: Tell me, then, philosopher - if patience delays the fostering of the other virtues, can it be rightly called virtuous?
Havkelaag_80.context: NodeContext: sligthly derisive, smug - he's had this argument in his head before and thinks he's absolutely won it with this point

Havkelaag_15.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_15.text: Patience does not delay, it simply tempers virtue. Curtails it from excess.

Havkelaag_108.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_108.text: A cautious, hesitant instinct. One I am afraid we do not have time for.

Havkelaag_45.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_45.text: By your words, any virtue delaying patience would itself be unvirtuous.

Havkelaag_26.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_26.text: And therein lies your fault: you would have us argue in circles until the egg hatches naturally. Time we do not have.

Havkelaag_46.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_46.text: Perhaps not. Patience is important, but cannot impede the other virtues.

Havkelaag_90.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_90.text: Then we are in accord - the time for action is now.

Havkelaag_94.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_94.text: A worthwhile aspiration. You're welcome to the egg.

Havkelaag_29.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_29.text: No, thanks. I've grown quite attached to it.

Havkelaag_113.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_113.text: I'd no idea your kind were capable of showing such parental instincts.

Havkelaag_48.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_48.text: I assure you, forming any emotional attachment to the gith spawn is quite pointless. It will show you no such affection in return.

Havkelaag_47.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_47.text: Should you grow tired of your responsibilities, do bring the egg to me. I'll gladly take it off your hands.

Havkelaag_119.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_119.text: I'd like to become a member.

Havkelaag_83.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_83.text: A most intelligent impulse, but I'm afraid it simply isn't possible.

Havkelaag_91.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_91.text: New memberships are on hold for as long as those wretched Absolutists are banging on the city gates.

Havkelaag_138.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_138.text: It does, however, give you plenty of time to prepare your admission thesis. A brisk thirty-thousand words should be more than sufficient.

Havkelaag_50.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_50.text: I met one of your researchers in the Underdark. His name was Blurg.

Havkelaag_3.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_3.text: You don't say? Blurg happens to be upstairs, preparing a most unusual paper. I'm sure he'll be pleased to see a friendly face.

Havkelaag_66.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_66.text: I met two of your researchers in the Underdark - Blurg and Omeluum.

Havkelaag_13.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_13.text: A wonderful research partnership, I'm sure you'll agree. They are upstairs, if you wish to share any theories with them.

Havkelaag_98.speaker: Player
Havkelaag_98.text: 'The Society of Brilliance'? Looks like a library to me.

Havkelaag_71.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_71.text: I assure you, we are as well-provisioned an institution as any other you'll find in this city. We simply prefer to keep our wealth away from areas of study.
Havkelaag_71.context: NodeContext: Defensive, has heard this accusation before

Havkelaag_105.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_105.text: One must stay humble in order to achieve true academic rigour.

Havkelaag_38.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_38.text: I say - that wasn't a githyanki egg you were fiddling around with, was it?
Havkelaag_38.context: NodeContext: Curious, acting casual (he really wants the egg)

Havkelaag_70.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_70.text: How would you like to sell it to the Society of Brilliance? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Havkelaag_39.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_39.text: Ah, a fellow inhabitor of the Underdark.

Havkelaag_87.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_87.text: You find yourself in the cradle of all knowledge relating to our subterranean home: the Society of Brilliance.

Havkelaag_59.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_59.text: My thanks again for retrieving the specimen. It really is a perfect sample.

Havkelaag_60.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_60.text: The Society's doors are always open to those who value knowledge and the proper application of it.

Havkelaag_64.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_64.text: What are you playing at, destroying a perfectly good githyanki specimen like that? Utter foolishness.
Havkelaag_64.context: NodeContext: Just saw the player destroy the githyanki egg he wanted. Cna't believe your stupidity

Havkelaag_81.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_81.text: Changed your mind, have you? The offer's still there - a fair price for the spawn, I'd say. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Havkelaag_95.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_95.text: I knew you weren't Society material. I'll find another means of procuring an egg.

Havkelaag_141.speaker: Havkelaag
Havkelaag_141.text: Well met. What can the Society of Brilliance do for you?

GithBoy_30.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_30.text: You - you don't look like them. You look like me. Who are you?

GithBoy_125.speaker: Player
GithBoy_125.text: You've never seen another githyanki before?

GithBoy_86.speaker: Player
GithBoy_86.text: Do not demand answers of me, yank. Tell me what happened here.

GithBoy_85.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_85.text: Who are you? Another who needs to learn the difference between right and wrong?
GithBoy_85.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player emerges from the strange portal. They see Ptaris stood at the end of the wooden pier projecting out into the basement. He stands with his back to the player, perfectly still. At his feet is the body of Esther the expeditioner. As he speaks he turns to face the player.

Esther the expeditioner: S_GLO_Expeditioner_5f4048ba-72ef-43c2-9528-1c9a12f3f82f

GithBoy_121.speaker: Narrator
GithBoy_121.text: *A githyanki youth, and a familiar one at that. Can it be that this is the one who hatched from the egg you took from the crèche?*

GithBoy_114.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_114.text: It is my home, of course. Father raised me here. Taught me. Made me grow.

GithBoy_41.speaker: Player
GithBoy_41.text: It's nice to see you again, githyanki.

GithBoy_106.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_106.text: I am not a githyanki. Do not call me that!
GithBoy_106.context: NodeContext: Frantic- associates this word with the pain of his 'treatment'.

GithBoy_28.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_28.text: I am Ptaris. And I am good.

GithBoy_44.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_44.text: Father was bad. They all were. I tried to make them better, but they were not strong enough. They lacked resolve.

GithBoy_12.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_12.text: Havkelaag. He brought me from the shell. Raised me quickly. Taught me to be good. But he failed me.

GithBoy_34.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_34.text: He was not righteous. He was not innocent. His thoughts were impure.

GithBoy_33.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_33.text: Such evil can only be cured one way. With pain. With torment. And if that does not work - with death.

GithBoy_95.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_95.text: Tell me - are you a good person?

GithBoy_23.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_23.text: If you only think, then you do not know.

GithBoy_26.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_26.text: The Ptarian Code must be obeyed. This is the only way to be sure. Do you follow it?

GithBoy_45.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_45.text: It is honour. Justice. The true form of goodness we all must live by, decreed by Bahamut himself.

GithBoy_11.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_11.text: You are not capable of following its teachings.

GithBoy_105.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_105.text: I know what you did to me. I see the memory of it, right there in your head.
GithBoy_105.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

GithBoy_2.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_2.text: You stole me from my people. Gave me to that woman. Unhatched, defenceless. You let me be brought here so father could hurt me.
GithBoy_2.context: NodeContext: Not betraying any strong emotion

GithBoy_130.speaker: Lae'zel
GithBoy_130.text: A githyanki raised in isolation. His blood boils like his kin's, but their ways are foreign.

GithBoy_91.speaker: Lae'zel
GithBoy_91.text: A githyanki raised in isolation. His blood boils like Vlaakith's, but he knows nothing of the Protocols.

GithBoy_132.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_132.text: You are bad. You must be taught a lesson.
GithBoy_132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Psionic energy begins to build around the boy. He is about to attack.NodeContext: Like this is the onyl reasonable conclusion

GithBoy_21.speaker: Player
GithBoy_21.text: You feel strange, don't you? That's your conscience. It's telling you to stop.

GithBoy_141.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_141.text: Father said I lacked a conscience. He said I was a nasty, evil thing, but he could make me good. He cured me.

GithBoy_15.speaker: Player
GithBoy_15.text: I thought I was saving you. I had no idea what they were planning.

GithBoy_123.speaker: Player
GithBoy_123.text: I never should have saved you. But I'm happy to rectify my mistake.

GithBoy_48.speaker: Player
GithBoy_48.text: You would have been destroyed if not for me. I saved you.

GithBoy_128.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_128.text: You were trying to save me? I - I don't understand.

GithBoy_66.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_66.text: Evil can never save good. But good can cure evil. I will save you yet.

GithBoy_78.speaker: Player
GithBoy_78.text: I wield my anger like a blade, but it does not rule me. I am no more 'bad' than you are.

GithBoy_49.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_49.text: You mean anger is not always bad? But - but that's not what father said.

GithBoy_61.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_61.text: Father saved me. I was a nasty, evil thing, but his treatments made me good. I - I'm cured.
GithBoy_61.context: NodeContext: Still aggressive, but with a hint of uncertainty

GithBoy_8.speaker: Player
GithBoy_8.text: He lied to you. No one is born evil.

GithBoy_57.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_57.text: But - but why would he hurt me if I didn't need to be cured?

GithBoy_87.speaker: Player
GithBoy_87.text: Good people offer forgiveness to those who sin. Not death.

GithBoy_50.speaker: Player
GithBoy_50.text: Cured? You still look like a githyanki to me.

GithBoy_17.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_17.text: I could not change that, even if I wanted to.

GithBoy_27.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_27.text: I - I killed him. I killed all these people. I am no better than any of them.

GithBoy_65.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_65.text: The code is flawed. And I am a monster, as he said I was. I cannot be trusted.

GithBoy_129.speaker: Lae'zel
GithBoy_129.text: He is lost. A shame - he could have proved a great ally to Orpheus.

GithBoy_131.speaker: Lae'zel
GithBoy_131.text: His mind is forever lost. Come - he is no use to us, nor my queen.

GithBoy_84.speaker: Player
GithBoy_84.text: You were cured of nothing. Only a true githyanki would destroy their enemy so thoroughly.

GithBoy_109.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_109.text: No - that's not why I did it. He was bad. I - I thought he deserved it.

GithBoy_24.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_24.text: Lies. Only death can save you now.

GithBoy_63.speaker: Player
GithBoy_63.text: Ungrateful yank. Our kin would have destroyed you if it wasn't for me.

GithBoy_0.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_0.text: I did the right thing. I followed the code. He deserved it. They all deserved it!

GithBoy_46.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_46.text: I should feel better now. Why don't I feel better?

GithBoy_127.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_127.text: No! No! Do not touch my thoughts. They are good. I am GOOD!
GithBoy_127.context: NodeContext: Agonized - his mind has been tormented by his 'father' Havkelaag

GithBoy_22.speaker: Player
GithBoy_22.text: I gave you what my patron gave me - a chance at something more.

GithBoy_117.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_117.text: I will cleanse the evil from you. Your nature can be changed. I -
GithBoy_117.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy puts both palms to his head, as though in distress.

GithBoy_144.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_144.text: Your mind. Evil writhes within it. You cannot be cured. You must be destroyed.

GithBoy_81.speaker: Player
GithBoy_81.text: I follow my gut. That's all anyone can do.

GithBoy_35.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_35.text: Your gut cannot be trusted. That is why the code exists. That is why you failed.

GithBoy_4.speaker: Player
GithBoy_4.text: I live by my own code, though not the one you speak of.

GithBoy_37.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_37.text: Then your code is flawed. Your actions cannot be defended.

GithBoy_98.speaker: Player
GithBoy_98.text: No one code can define goodness. It's impossible.

GithBoy_120.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_120.text: Only a bad person would say that. And that's what you are.

GithBoy_36.speaker: Player
GithBoy_36.text: The Ptarian code? Then you follow the teachings of Bahamut?

GithBoy_83.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_83.text: The purest of your rulers. But you are nothing like him. You are tainted.

GithBoy_100.speaker: Player
GithBoy_100.text: The code of Bahamut. His guidance leads me in all things.

GithBoy_143.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_143.text: Do you really believe that? You are unfit to say his name.

GithBoy_73.speaker: Player
GithBoy_73.text: I know of it. All such codes require self-discipline. In all such codes, murder is a violation.

GithBoy_119.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_119.text: Yet you have killed, many times. It is engraved on your memories. You are a hypocrite.

GithBoy_145.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_145.text: There is only one way. The Ptarian code. Do you follow it?

GithBoy_116.speaker: Player
GithBoy_116.text: I'm good at being bad. Does that count?

GithBoy_51.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_51.text: You cannot be both good and bad. It is impossible. There is no goodness in you.

GithBoy_54.speaker: Player
GithBoy_54.text: I've tried to be, though I've failed often enough.

GithBoy_19.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_19.text: Then perhaps I am one of your failures.

GithBoy_10.speaker: Player
GithBoy_10.text: Right and wrong don't matter so long as you get the job done.

GithBoy_6.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_6.text: I see. You have abandoned goodness. Like you abandoned me.

GithBoy_133.speaker: Player
GithBoy_133.text: I try to be, but sometimes my magic has other ideas.

GithBoy_32.speaker: Player
GithBoy_32.text: I try to be. For I serve a greater power - one who embodies everything good in this world.

GithBoy_59.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_59.text: There is no 'try'. You are either good or you are not.

GithBoy_29.speaker: Player
GithBoy_29.text: Please - there is no 'good'. There is only the power one wields over others.

GithBoy_79.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_79.text: So that is why you did it.

GithBoy_97.speaker: Player
GithBoy_97.text: I try not to look at things as good or evil. Life is a mixture of both.

GithBoy_101.speaker: Player
GithBoy_101.text: I fight, eat, drink, love, and hate with everything I have - that is all that matters.

GithBoy_5.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_5.text: Such an empty and  meaningless life.

GithBoy_9.speaker: Player
GithBoy_9.text: We're not having this conversation. If you massacred those people, you must pay the price.

GithBoy_13.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_13.text: You would speak of punishment to me?

GithBoy_47.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_47.text: I see it. Your head is filled with evil. There is no goodness there.

GithBoy_1.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_1.text: You are unfit to live. I will see that you are expunged.

GithBoy_88.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_88.text: She did not have the strength to be good. She was another like father - lacking in moral fibre.
GithBoy_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ptaris looks down, as though only just remembering Esther lies dead at his feet.NodeContext: Indifferent to the dead body at his feet.

GithBoy_64.speaker: Player
GithBoy_64.text: What did they do that was so terrible?

GithBoy_110.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_110.text: They did not live up to father's code. Even he did not follow it correctly.

GithBoy_89.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_89.text: It is not my fault they died. I was only upholding father's code. Even he was not strong enough to follow it.

GithBoy_102.speaker: Player
GithBoy_102.text: Don't worry - I'm not here to judge.

GithBoy_142.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_142.text: Everyone judges, and everyone must be judged. This is the only way to know if we are good enough. Father was not.

GithBoy_68.speaker: Player
GithBoy_68.text: A githyanki? What are you doing down here?

GithBoy_113.speaker: Player
GithBoy_113.text: My oath helps me decide right from wrong - I need no teaching.

GithBoy_138.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_138.text: No. Everyone must learn. Right from wrong. Good from bad.

GithBoy_72.speaker: Player
GithBoy_72.text: I do not seek right or wrong. I seek balance.

GithBoy_111.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_111.text: No. You have to know right from wrong. Good from bad.

GithBoy_71.speaker: Player
GithBoy_71.text: Are you responsible for that massacre I just walked through?

GithBoy_124.speaker: Ptaris
GithBoy_124.text: Perhaps it is easier to be good when you are alone.

Blurg_1.speaker: Narrator
Blurg_1.text: *There is nothing left to speak of. His friend is gone, his focus now diverted to the nurturing  of Omeluum's legacy - his work.*

Blurg_13.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_13.text: You again. I hope you left your violent impulses back in the Underdark. They have no place in the Society of Brilliance.

Blurg_15.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_15.text: Omeluum tells me I have you to thank for its safe return.

Blurg_52.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_52.text: We know the risks when we go out into the field, but to lose my friend in such a way would have been most disheartening.

Blurg_87.speaker: Player
Blurg_87.text: Bravery is no bad thing. In fact, your research could be invaluable for my cause.

Blurg_78.speaker: Player
Blurg_78.text: You should stick to reading books. It's much safer.

Blurg_82.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_82.text: I know a wizard over in Elturel who'd disagree. Incurable paper cuts are no laughing matter.

Blurg_29.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_29.text: If there's any conclusion to be drawn from this, I think it's that Omeluum and I are safest back in the Underdark.

Blurg_36.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_36.text: Our research there must continue. We may not be able to fight on the front lines as you do, but we may yet do some good for those who call it home.

Blurg_21.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_21.text: We'll depart when this Absolute army is defeated. I understand you are involved in the matter.

Blurg_40.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_40.text: We will not let you leave empty-handed, though. Make sure you speak to Omeluum before you leave.

Blurg_7.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_7.text: Of course. And for a friend such as yourself, I'm happy to apply our full academic discount.

Blurg_88.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_88.text: Of course. And given the aid you provided to Omeluum, I'm happy to offer you Society member rates.

Blurg_77.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_77.text: I hope our gifts will provide you with some meaningful assistance in fighting the evil Omeluum uncovered. Do let us know how you get on.

Blurg_41.speaker: Player
Blurg_41.text: I usual tell people to keep to the city - but in your case, perhaps the wilds are safer.

Blurg_16.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_16.text: Is there something I can do for you?

Blurg_25.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_25.text: Is there anything I can do for you, friend?

Blurg_28.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_28.text: My surface-dwelling friend. I take it you were curious to see the Society of Brilliance for yourself?

Blurg_39.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_39.text: The lure of knowledge is a hard one to resist. Even where it requires us to endure discomfort.

Blurg_2.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_2.text: For example, it is quite bright up here. I had forgotten about the malady known as 'sunburn'.

Blurg_26.speaker: Player
Blurg_26.text: I hear there's an unguent that protects against the sun's powers...

Blurg_9.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_9.text: A field of research I am glad exists - it will be of immense value for those exposed to it on a more regular basis.

Blurg_63.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_63.text: As for me - I'll remain indoors. The Society's library will keep me quite busy until I return to my research in the Underdark.

Blurg_56.speaker: Player
Blurg_56.text: Why did you leave the Underdark?

Blurg_24.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_24.text: We are required to attend the Lodge from time to time, in order to present our findings to the Society's members.

Blurg_69.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_69.text: My research partner prefers to avoid crowds, and so has remained in the Underdark to monitor our zurkhwood samples.

Blurg_76.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_76.text: I am eager to return myself, but I must prepare my treatise before I depart. Sharing knowledge is one of the Society's most important tenets.

Blurg_61.speaker: Player
Blurg_61.text: What's the subject of your treatise?

Blurg_80.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_80.text: 'The Underused Underdark: Applications for Zurkhwood in Unlocking the Future of Subterranean Civilisations.'

Blurg_48.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_48.text: I may be indulging myself somewhat with its title, but I do believe our research harbours such potential. I only hope the Society's members agree.

Blurg_79.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_79.text: Speaking of which, I should get back to annotating my references. Is there anything else I can do for you?

Blurg_32.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_32.text: Of course. I always carry samples, in case there are inquiring minds looking to purchase them.

Blurg_51.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_51.text: Then I wish you a pleasant day. May it bring you a wealth of discoveries.

Blurg_38.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_38.text: It seems your aggression has its uses after all. Omeluum tells me I've you to thank for its safe return.

Blurg_43.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_43.text: My surface-dwelling friend. How long has it been?

Blurg_12.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_12.text: I am glad to see you well. I see your tadpole remains in its state of suspension.

Blurg_74.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_74.text: Your case has set us on quite the detour from our planned expedition work. We've thought about very little else.

Blurg_3.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_3.text: In the field, seeking further subjects for study. Though it has been gone for longer than I anticipated.

Blurg_53.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_53.text: After observing the nature of your tadpole's stasis, we felt it wise to report back to the Society.

Blurg_65.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_65.text: Omeluum went out into the city to seek out further undeveloped infections like yours, but I have heard nothing since.

Blurg_55.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_55.text: I admit, I'm somewhat concerned. We are usually sticklers for updating one another on our progress.

Blurg_89.speaker: Player
Blurg_89.text: I have bad news. Your friend the mind flayer, Omeluum, is dead.

Blurg_84.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_84.text: Poor Omeluum. This is terrible news. Our research is meant for good - it should not get us killed.

Blurg_90.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_90.text: Omeluum would want me to continue its work, and I have a rudimentary understanding of its hypothesis.

Blurg_20.speaker: Player
Blurg_20.text: I'll track Omeluum down. Where was it headed?

Blurg_6.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_6.text: Omeluum believed the answer to this riddle lay within the city walls, and held some connection to the cult of the Absolute.

Blurg_46.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_46.text: I had the distinct impression it was intentionally keeping its hypothesis from me. As though even the theory would be enough to put me in danger.
Blurg_46.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound calm, but very worried

Blurg_86.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_86.text: Why that would be, I can only theorise myself. It is rather outside my area of expertise.

Blurg_4.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_4.text: Omeluum is most likely safe and well, and simply absorbed in its work. However, it would put my mind at rest to confirm it, if you happen across its path.
Blurg_4.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound calm, but very worried

Blurg_50.speaker: Player
Blurg_50.text: Perhaps Omeluum prefers to work alone, given its connection to the subject matter.

Blurg_44.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_44.text: A fair assumption. Omeluum is not given to strong emotion, but I know it regrets the damage caused by others of its kind.

Blurg_34.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_34.text: I am doing my best to conduct my own research in its absence.

Blurg_37.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_37.text: Unfortunately my second-hand knowledge does not compare to the innate understanding Omeluum brings to such study.

Blurg_14.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_14.text: Naturally. The Underdark provided us with some most unusual salvage. Plenty to keep an inquiring mind busy.

Blurg_18.speaker: Player
Blurg_18.text: Now is not the time for concern - now is a time for action. Go out and find your friend!

Blurg_30.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_30.text: To jump to action without evidence is hardly becoming of the Society of Brilliance.

Blurg_59.speaker: Player
Blurg_59.text: I'll head out now - see if I can pick up Omeluum's trail.

Blurg_5.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_5.text: Of course. I should get back to my research.

Blurg_17.speaker: Player
Blurg_17.text: I thought you were conducting research in the Underdark?

Blurg_11.speaker: Player
Blurg_11.text: I've become quite the expert on my tadpole since we last met.

Blurg_83.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_83.text: You have? I would love to hear your conclusions, but it would not feel right to do so without my research partner.

Blurg_54.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_54.text: Your tadpole's stasis is a most curious area of study. I will have much to share with Omeluum upon its return.

Blurg_64.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_64.text: We meet again. This time without the need for violence, I hope.
Blurg_64.context: NodeContext: Not impressed with the player, but moving on from your conflict

Blurg_70.speaker: Blurg
Blurg_70.text: I see you have not yet undergone ceremorphosis. I can only assume your tadpole remains in stasis.

SwD_Havkelaag_16.speaker: Narrator
SwD_Havkelaag_16.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

SwD_Havkelaag_19.speaker: Havkelaag
SwD_Havkelaag_19.text: Experiment... gone wrong... not my fault.

SwD_Havkelaag_9.speaker: Havkelaag
SwD_Havkelaag_9.text: Proving theory... genetic morality... I was right.

SwD_Havkelaag_2.speaker: Narrator
SwD_Havkelaag_2.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

SwD_Havkelaag_20.speaker: Narrator
SwD_Havkelaag_20.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

SwD_Havkelaag_22.speaker: Narrator
SwD_Havkelaag_22.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

PAD_GithKidMassacre_0.speaker: Player
PAD_GithKidMassacre_0.text: What a scene. Whoever did this had no rhyme or reason - just viciousness.

AD_SocietyMember_04_Idle_0.speaker: Professor Limeleech
AD_SocietyMember_04_Idle_0.text: Given the chance, I'd make a fine Principal Researcher.

AD_SocietyMember_04_Idle_1.speaker: Professor Limeleech
AD_SocietyMember_04_Idle_1.text: Strange to think that I'm both brilliant and extremely attractive.

AD_SocietyMember_04_Idle_2.speaker: Professor Limeleech
AD_SocietyMember_04_Idle_2.text: I admit it - I'm jealous of Blurg's towering intellect.

AD_Blurg_Idle_0.speaker: Blurg
AD_Blurg_Idle_0.text: Hmm. There's a distinctly Netherese taint to the air in this city.

AD_Blurg_Idle_1.speaker: Blurg
AD_Blurg_Idle_1.text: It's hard to explain, but I'm happier when I'm around Omeluum.

AD_Blurg_Idle_2.speaker: Blurg
AD_Blurg_Idle_2.text: Research on the surface stops during what they call 'night'. I still can't get used to that.

AD_SocietyMember_03_Idle_0.speaker: Lorlarrio
AD_SocietyMember_03_Idle_0.text: The long vowel shift in Middle Kobold is fascinating.

AD_SocietyMember_03_Idle_1.speaker: Lorlarrio
AD_SocietyMember_03_Idle_1.text: I wonder what Professor Limeleech really thinks of me?

AD_SocietyMember_03_Idle_2.speaker: Lorlarrio
AD_SocietyMember_03_Idle_2.text: Must remember it's 'CH-CH-CH' in the back of the throat.

AD_PtarisFightShouting_0.speaker: Ptaris
AD_PtarisFightShouting_0.text: You're bad, so surrender and die. First you, and then...

AD_PtarisFightShouting_1.speaker: Ptaris
AD_PtarisFightShouting_1.text: You must know you are bad and must be destroyed. Why deny it?

AD_PtarisFightShouting_2.speaker: Ptaris
AD_PtarisFightShouting_2.text: Father was false! I am false! Everything is false!

AD_PtarisFightShouting_3.speaker: Ptaris
AD_PtarisFightShouting_3.text: Good battles evil. Good destroys evil.

AD_OmeluumAndBlurgChatting_1.speaker: Blurg
AD_OmeluumAndBlurgChatting_1.text: How do you pass through the city streets without exciting opprobrium?

AD_OmeluumAndBlurgChatting_0.speaker: Omeluum
AD_OmeluumAndBlurgChatting_0.text: I adopt the illusory appearance of someone else. You, for example.

AD_OmeluumAndBlurgChatting_3.speaker: Blurg
AD_OmeluumAndBlurgChatting_3.text: So your escape from the Iron Throne was a narrow one?

AD_OmeluumAndBlurgChatting_2.speaker: Omeluum
AD_OmeluumAndBlurgChatting_2.text: Indeed! I find I now have an irrational fear of deep water.

AD_Havkelaag_Idle_0.speaker: Havkelaag
AD_Havkelaag_Idle_0.text: The implications of my theory are significant. Even profound!

AD_Havkelaag_Idle_1.speaker: Havkelaag
AD_Havkelaag_Idle_1.text: Genetic morality is not just theory, but fact!

AD_Havkelaag_Idle_2.speaker: Havkelaag
AD_Havkelaag_Idle_2.text: I heard laughter this morning. At me? Perhaps.

AD_SocietyMember_02_Idle_0.speaker: Delverdenn
AD_SocietyMember_02_Idle_0.text: Why can't a man be passionate about mineral ores?

AD_SocietyMember_02_Idle_1.speaker: Delverdenn
AD_SocietyMember_02_Idle_1.text: The Mermaid is such a dive. I wish the Elfsong were closer.

AD_SocietyMember_02_Idle_2.speaker: Delverdenn
AD_SocietyMember_02_Idle_2.text: I remember my first smelter with real fondness.

AD_PtarisBeforeFight_1.speaker: Ptaris
AD_PtarisBeforeFight_1.text: Who's that? Someone's here! Who are you?

AD_PtarisBeforeFight_2.speaker: Ptaris
AD_PtarisBeforeFight_2.text: Death to the unrighteous! That's what you taught me!
